analysis.narrative:
ðŸ“Š **Consensus:** Market exhibits MIXED conviction with bullish momentum in select assets (commodities, crypto, mega-cap tech) offset by deteriorating breadth and technical exhaustion signals. Conviction: MEDIUM. Bullish narratives rest on monetary policy tailwinds and productivity themes; bearish warnings cite breadth collapse and concentrated leadership masking underlying weakness.

ðŸ“ˆ **Themes:** (1) Monetary policy easing cycle supporting rate-sensitive assets and growth equities; (2) AI/automation productivity narrative driving mega-cap tech valuations; (3) Breadth divergence and technical exhaustion in extended assets (commodities show exhaustion gap formations, momentum screener participation declining) signaling vulnerability to correction; (4) Execution risk in software and financial services with guidance cuts suggesting smoother earnings growth may not materialize; (5) Bifurcation between mainstream institutional optimism and concentrated positioning creating asymmetric downside risk.

ðŸŽ¯ **Levels:** SPY ($690.31): Call Wall $700 (146k OI - active, 1.4% away), Put Wall $640 (153k OI - dormant, 7.3% away). Max Pain $686. Near support $670 (45k OI - active, 2.9%). QQQ ($623.89): Call Wall $630 (33k OI - active, 1.0% away), Put Wall $590 (164k OI - dormant, 5.4% away). Max Pain $621. Near resistance $625 (29k OI - active, 0.2%), $640 (31k OI - active, 2.6%). Note: /ES futures levels per Twitter noted around support/resistance zones but attributed to Twitter source; Bitcoin >$90K and Ethereum >$3K per Twitter with complacency warnings; Silver showing exhaustion gaps and overhead resistance per Twitter; MicroStrategy support at $150 per Twitter.
key_themes: Breadth divergence and momentum screener weakness despite all-time highs
Monetary policy easing cycle supporting growth and rate-sensitive assets
Technical exhaustion in extended commodities (silver 87% above 200-day MA)
Execution risk in software and financial services with guidance cuts
Concentrated mega-cap tech leadership masking narrow participation
risk_factors: Silver and commodity technical breakdown triggering broader risk-off rotation
Earnings disappointments in software and financial services validating guidance-cut warnings
Breadth failure to recover to 150+ momentum names despite new index highs signals capitulation vulnerability
Geopolitical escalation or Fed pause signals inverting macro tailwind narrative
Bitcoin complacency break below $90K potentially deflating crypto/risk-on sentiment
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: Testing $700 call wall (active hedging resistance) with $690 support nearby; watch for breakout above $700 or reversal toward $670 active support. QQQ: Extremely tight range with $625-$630 resistance (both active hedging levels <1-2.6% away) and $590 put wall dormant below; intraday breakout above $630 would test $640 resistance, breakdown below $625 would test support.
analysis.swing_levels: SPY: Primary resistance at $700 (call wall); if broken, next target $730-$750 (dormant resistance). Primary support at $670 (active, 2.9%), then $645 (dormant, 6.6%), then $640 put wall (dormant, 7.3%). Breakdown below $670 would signal shift toward $640. QQQ: Resistance at $630-$640 (both active); failure to break above suggests mean reversion toward $621 max pain, then $590 put wall. Twitter analysis warns of sideways-to-lower consolidation next 2-4 weeks with silver technical breakdown potentially accelerating broader correction; RSS warns of volatile range-bound trading with downside risks from earnings disappointments.

regime.label: NEUTRAL
regime.summary: Market is lacking clear direction. Wait for confirmation.

action.summary: NEUTRAL: No clear edge. Cash is a position.
